reviews.review_msg: Aknin is patient & kind in class. Her lectures are interesting & easy to understand. That said, the marking guidelines & criteria aren't clear, the assignments aren't marked consistent with guidelines, Aknin isn't supportive one-on-one, & Aknin wasn't open to discussing my concerns about the class even though I approached her very respectfully.

Great teacher. Easy to talk to and willing to help dilemmas involving test times. She makes two part exams, in which the second part lets you talk to other people and retake the multiple choice in order to raise your grade. Her ultimate goal is to get people to learn, and love what they learn.

Lara is hands down the best prof at sfu! She keeps the class engaged by making the class fun & genuinley cares about her students! If you put in the effort you will definitely see results. Although the info is interesting the exams are quite difficult. Therefore go to her office hours! She cares abt her students doing well. Tho TAs are hard markers
Lara is an amazing professor but the TA's graded really hard. The grading was also tough and it was hard to even pass. The course is really enjoyable but is definitely not an easy class.
She is the nicest prof ever! It's not a super easy class, but it's fun and she is a good teacher.

Fun and energetic. Make sure you pay attention to the two 'course themes' which will be in the written. Hard to get an A even if work hard. Always answers emails cares a lot about students. Way to much detail is required for written things that dont even seem important.

He talks way too fast in class, and had no notes up. If you missed what he said, hopefully your friend next to you heard. I did better in my final when I simply didnt go to class and listened to the lectures online, that way I can go back and write down what he said.
One of the few classes I actually enjoyed going to, he's great at making lectures engaging although talks quite fast.

Honestly one of the best classes i'v ever taken at SFU. But yea, the grading system is a little unfair, I got away with a C+ but I know I got around 83~87%, in other courses, i wouldve gotten a B-? Anyways, take the course!
Amazing prof.. Fair exams/essays/assignments, just do the work & you'll be fine. Unfortunately grading scale is tough! a D is 60%-69%, beware of that!

loved this prof! he was soo good and make everything even more interesting. great teaching style and enjoyable class! exams were very fair, 2 easy papers and simple assignments that are done in 5 minutes basically free marks.. great class

i love him!He's the best prof ever!He's funny and engages the audiences very well!Shows lots of interest and affections towards this course.Very honest guy too!Explain everything very detail & lots of examples as well!He is very friendly & helpful.Easy marks for the assignements!! His markings were fair!And he is super funny!!! Thats the best!

Worst professor ever. The reason why his lecture seems so short is because he talks about same thing over and over again. His notes sucks and doesnt make any sense. Lecture recording only available when u sign up, which is inconvinient when u really need it. His exams r tricky and so much wordings in mutiple choice questions. My biggest mistake eve

A great all-round professor. His lectures are entertaining and he engages the audience well.  Great sense of humour. His interesting analogies will ensure you never fall asleep and he makes 1.5 hours seem like 30 mins! One note however, he does try to impose his political views on the students.

The tutorials were better than the lectures. He is all over the place with his stories!  Tests were fairly easy but his marking scheme was crazy! He should have looked into marking on the curve BEFORE the midterm. Don't know if I'll take any more Psych courses with him again.
very boring. never lectures beyond  his notes which he posts online. no need to go to class

This is not a writing course, yet 45% of the mark is devoted to writing. Weekly assignments and three 10% assignments for which the instructions must be followed to a T (any formatting/grammatical error decreases one's mark). The material is interesting but she is boring - she uses up the entire 3 hours for material that can be covered in 1 hour.

Ridiculous amount of homework (thought papers and assignments). Style of marking is unclear and unreasonably picky. Feedbacks about your writing are not helpful and accurate at all. Professor is interesting and engaging, and the class is fun, but you are required to memorize a lot. A lot of materials to study. But honestly, don't take it with her.
This is the WORST professor ever. The lectures are painful and extremely b..o..r..i..n..g!

For a 200 level course, I thought it was a lot of work. The assignments are so broad that it almost becomes difficult. Anyways, if you are a strong writer, you should take the course with her. And attending lectures gets extra marks!

Yes, her midterm and final were hard, and yes she does go slower than the average prof. But it's pretty obvious it was her first semester and shes very open to suggestions. The assignments were a free 30% and took maybe 15 minutes a week.

avoid at all costs. Final was composed almost entirely of questions about what study did what. If you didn't rote memorize every study in the whole chapter for each topic, then you cant do well on midterms or the final. Trivial questions that are irrelevant and awkward. Don't take this class if you value the money you spend on tuition.

Lectures are painfully dry to sit through. She speaks far too slowly, and it is nearly impossible to follow her train of thought - let alone focus in the 3 hour lecture. Memorizing countless studies is the only thing important, apparently.

Her lecture material is interesting but can be hard to follow at times. A lot of studies were presented in class and it's hard to know what to know and what to discard. Exams were fair except for the part where if you don't memorize studies and their implications; you're screwed.

She talks about 3 times slower than that of a regular person...has ZERO personality, kind of like a robot! Tries to make in-class activities to promote attendance, but her lectures condescending and painful to sit through...avoid at all costs
